meanings.definition: Extend out, over, or beyond the main body or line of something.
meanings.sent1: The tree branch was jutting out from the trunk.
meanings.sent2: The rock was jutting out of the ground.
meanings.sent3: The pencil jutting out of the cup looked like a tiny flag.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was jutting out like a beacon in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The mountain peak jutting into the sky was a majestic sight.

meanings.sent1: The nail was jutting out of the wall.
meanings.sent2: His jawline was jutting out prominently.
meanings.sent3: The cat's tail jutting out behind it made it look like a tiny flag bearer.
meanings.sent4: His words were jutting out like sharp arrows in the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The ship's bow jutting into the waves was a powerful image.
